explanation: The report is not correct. Rule 8.13 states that pointers should be to const-qualified types when the pointed-to object is not modified. In the shown OS_TaskPrepare function the pointer parameter entrypt is an output parameter (it is assigned *entrypt = ... and later possibly set to NULL) so it cannot be const-qualified. The only other pointer mentioned by the agent is the data parameter of OS_NotifyEvent. That parameter is simply forwarded to the registered EventHandler; whether it can be const-qualified depends on the EventHandler callback type and all call sites. If the EventHandler type and callers require a mutable void * then OS_NotifyEvent cannot safely change to const void * without changing the API. The code as presented does not prove a violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 in OS_TaskPrepare, and there is insufficient evidence (no EventHandler prototype shown) to claim a Rule 8.13 violation in OS_NotifyEvent. Therefore the reported violation is incorrect.
